title: Asian Junk Bonds Set for Stronger 2022 After Property Turmoil
sub_head: Chinese policy easing could help drive rebound, investors and analysts say
body:
After this year’s punishing selloff in Asian junk bonds, due largely to the turmoil in Chinese property, some investors and analysts are cautiously optimistic about the outlook for 2022.
Investors say Chinese authorities are likely to ease up somewhat on the embattled real-estate sector and to loosen monetary policy, helping support Chinese corporate borrowers more broadly. The People’s Bank of China last week cut banks’ reserve requirements, a move some economists said could signal the start of an easing cycle.
